conclusion: To find the work done externally by the gas from state B to state C, calculate the area under the curve in the p-V diagram from B to C.
At state B: p_B = 2 x 10^5 Pa, V_B = 1 x 10^-3 m^3; At state C: p_C = 2 x 10^5 Pa, V_C = 3 x 10^-3 m^3.
The process from B to C is isobaric (constant pressure) since the pressure remains at 2 x 10^5 Pa.
For an isobaric process, work W is given by W = p ΔV.
Calculate the change in volume: ΔV = V_C - V_B = 2 x 10^-3 m^3.
Compute the work done: W = 2 x 10^5 Pa x 2 x 10^-3 m^3 = 400 J.
The work done externally by the gas from state B to state C is 400 J.
